Disease.content:
Please identify the "Disease" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Olanzapine - treated patients demonstrated a higher rate of response ( 65 % vs 43 % , respectively ; P = . 02 ) and euthymia ( 61 % vs 36 % , respectively ; P = . 01 ) than placebo - treated patients .

Let's think step by step.

| Disease |
| --- |
| euthymia |

Note: Euthymia is a term used in psychiatry to describe a state of normal or usual mood, i.e., the absence of depression or mania. It is not a disease itself, but a symptom or a state of well-being. However, since it was mentioned in the context of a comparison with a treatment group, I have included it as a disease entity in this table.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Disease" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Disease |
| --- |
| euthymia |

Note: In this paragraph, there is only one term that can be considered a disease entity, which is "euthymia". The other terms, such as "response" and "placebo", do not refer to specific diseases.
